newsitem.title: UK: Soco fixes placing price at 260p per share.
newsitem.headline: Soco fixes placing price at 260p per share.

text.p: Oil and gas company Soco International Plc said on Friday that the placing price, relating to its planned listing on the London Stock Exchange, has been fixed at 260p per share.
It said in a statement that 32.98 million shares were being placed to raise 85.7 million stg.
At the placing price the market capitalisation of the company will be around 128 million stg. It expects dealings in new shares to start on May 29.
Soco is being formed by combining the assets of U.S.-based Snyder Oil and Britain's Cairn Energy Plc. Snyder will own a 14 to 17 percent stake in Soco.
Soco said that the money raised will include 39.3 million of new money for the company.
"The funds raised by the flotation will be used to develop our portfolio of projects, particularly those in Mongolio," said Ed Story, chief executive of Soco.
